name: Awatuna Homestead

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great stay at the Awatuna Homestead last week. Hemi and his family were very welcoming and gave us great tips on touring the west coast of the South Island. We enjoyed our stay there very much.
reviews.title: Very welcoming B & B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our overnight at Awatuna Homestead very much. We received a friendly welcome, and when we asked about Hemi's cars he was quite happy to let us see them. We enjoyed seeing the weather house (green house) as well, and felt comfortable and at home in the garden.
reviews.title: lovely stay
It's worth the drive.
reviews.text: We were given directions to Hokitika Gorge and went on some great hikes in the area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we stayed in was very nice. Love the lodge! Everything was clean, breakfast was delicious. Pauline and Hemi are great, and we would stay there again!
reviews.title: Wonderful experience-wish we could have stayed longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this accommodation after a shocking night of disrupted sleep at Stumpers, what a dump. The beach views were amazing and as it was beginning to storm, the seas were really high and quite noisy, which I really liked. A great location, very clean and comfortable. Cheryl and Malcolm are a lovely couple they give you enough space and time to unwind and are also happy to have a chat. Lovely breakfast and conversation with other guests. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: A comfortable rural haven, excellent hosts and fab food!

description: Beautiful Colonial-style Family Homestead since 1874, situated between Hokitika & Greymouth by the sea. Elegant, boutique lodging, set in park-like gardens. Superior ensuite rooms & 1 self-contained Apartment. Separate guest lounge, WiFi.Eco-conscious professional hosts. Organic produce grown for Homestead table. Maori cultural histories & storytelling. Guided beach walks. Outdoor Spa, 2 friendly dogs, vintage cars. Dinner by prior arrangement. 10 mins to Hokitika and lakes, shops and craftspeople. Glaciers/Punakaiki Rocks 2 hours from Homestead
